Object.Name: Battery
Object.Description1: The uCIFI battery object provides attributes to monitor battery level and activity.

Item.Name: Battery level
Item.Description: Level of charge of the battery in % of total possible charge.

Item.Name: Battery capacity
Item.Description: Nominal capacity of the battery in Ampere hour.

Item.Name: Battery voltage
Item.Description: Level of charge of the battery in Volts.

Item.Name: Type of battery
Item.Description: Describes the type of battery (e.g. Li-Ion rechargeable).

Item.Name: Low battery threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which an event is generated by the device.

Item.Name: Battery level too low
Item.Description: Set to True if battery level is below or equal the low battery threshold. Set to False otherwise.

Item.Name: Battery shutdown
Item.Description: Indicates that the device has shut down due to battery discharge. Can be reset by central application.

Item.Name: Number of cycles
Item.Description: Number of times the battery has discharged and recharged.

Item.Name: Supply loss
Item.Description: Applies for battery devices that are also connected to mains supply. Set to True when mains power is lost. Set to False when mains power is back.

Item.Name: Supply loss counter
Item.Description: Number of supply losses since last reset.

Item.Name: Supply loss reason
Item.Description: Reason identified by the device why the device has lost mains supply (e.g. lightning if the device measured a high voltage, accident if the device identified a move with an accelerometer).

Item.Name: Timestamp
Item.Description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Item.Name: Fractional Timestamp
Item.Description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Indicator
Item.Description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Level
Item.Description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.
